All known major data flows have now been restored and backfilled. Engineering teams will ensure any minor edge data discrepancies are restored before Friday, November 14th.

The issue impacting messages created between 05:00-05:10 and 05:30-05:40 UTC on Oct 28 which were not retrievable via the Messaging Logs API and the Messaging Console is now resolved. incidents.name: Video-Rtc-Services-Register Cannot Access dynamoDB

incident_updates.body: The Video Services connectivity issue with DynamoDB is operating normally at this time.

The Video Services connectivity issue with DynamoDB is now operating normally. Users should be able to use all Video functionality without errors. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 16 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

The Video Services connectivity issue with DynamoDB is now operating normally. Users should be able to use all Video functionality without errors. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 8 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

The Video Services connectivity issue with DynamoDB is now operating normally. Users should be able to use all Video functionality without errors. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are currently investigating an issue in which some video participants are unable to generate tokens correctly/ taking longer due to the video-rtc-services-register services inability to access dynamoDB. This impacts the production Twilio environment, affecting users attempting to join or establish video sessions through Video Rooms. While the service remains degraded but usable, affected participants may experience delays or failures when attempting to join video calls. The scope of customer impact depends on the percentage of requests currently failing and how long the dynamoDB access issue persists. Users should be advised that video functionality may be intermittently unavailable during this incident.  Our engineers are working to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Inbound Calls From Carrier Peering Experiencing Drops in the United States

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We are seeing recovery of the issue with inbound calls from our Carrier Peering are being dropped due to missing RTP after our Engineers rolled back an update. Our engineering teams are monitoring this incident to ensure a full recovery. We will provide in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are still investigating an issue where inbound calls from our Carrier Peering are being dropped due to missing RTP after an UPDATE. Twilio continues to send RTP, but our carrier is not receiving it, resulting in calls ending from the carrier side. This may cause dropped calls for customers using our Carrier Peering. Our engineering teams are actively working with our partners to resolve the issue as quickly as possible. We will provide in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are still investigating an issue where inbound calls from our Carrier Peering are being dropped due to missing RTP after an UPDATE. Twilio continues to send RTP, but our carrier is not receiving it, resulting in calls ending from the carrier side. This may cause dropped calls for customers using our Carrier Peering. Our engineering teams are actively working with our partners to resolve the issue as quickly as possible. We will provide in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are still investigating an issue where inbound calls from our Carrier Peering are being dropped due to missing RTP after an UPDATE. Twilio continues to send RTP, but our carrier is not receiving it, resulting in calls ending from the carrier side. This may cause dropped calls for customers using our Carrier Peering.
